properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 10 at 4:18PM EST until February 15 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a Flood
Advisory for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...

Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County.

.The Ohio River at Pittsburgh is expected to rise above 18 feet
overnight due to recent rainfall, flooding the Monongahela Parking
Wharf. The threat for additional rainfall and subsequent rise will
prompt the continuation of the advisory through the end of the week,
despite a brief period where the Point may fall below 18 feet .

The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a

* Flood Advisory for
the Ohio River At Pittsburgh.
* From this afternoon to Saturday morning.
* At 3:45 PM EST Monday the stage was 17.2 feet.
* Action stage is 18.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise to 18.8 feet early tomorrow
afternoon. It will then fall to 17.5 feet and begin rising again
Thursday morning. It will rise to 19.0 feet Friday morning. It
will then fall again and remain below flood stage.
* Impact...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela
Parking Wharf.
* Impact...At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the north shore
riverwalk between the stadiums.
* Impact...At 19.5 feet, The Mon Parking Wharf is completely flooded.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated. Heed any
road closures.

Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz .
